poem:
The Reef's Lament

In the depths of coral's cry,  
whispers of smoke ascend,  
Australia's voice, a fading sigh,  
as nature's walls defend.  
Beyond the reach of crafted hand,  
politics shadow the reef,  
a fragile beauty, sinking sand,  
mired in whispered grief.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Australia tried to influence other countries and Unesco to keep Great Barrier Reef off in-danger list The Australian government carried out an international lobbying campaign to keep the Great Barrier Reef off a list of world heritage sites in danger, including dispatching politicians and officials to Unesco’s Paris headquarters and asking diplomats to gather intelligence on countries that could influence the decision. The campaign is revealed in documents released to the Greens after a parliamentary". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
